Legal_Issue: Whether the Citizenship Judge erred in concluding insufficient evidence of residency
Application_Facts: Applicant provided education, health records, and tax filings; lacked substantial employment or family ties in Canada
Decision_Outcome: Citizenship application denied due to insufficient residency evidence
Court_Ruling: Application allowed; case remanded for reconsideration by a different judge
Grounds_for_Claim: Insufficient evaluation of residency evidence by Citizenship Judge
Assessment_Factor: Physical presence, connection to Canada, gaps in employment, US bank activity
Applicable_Legislation: Citizenship Act - 1,095 days residency requirement within four years
Procedural_Issue: Appeal process and standard of review
Evidence_Used: Education records, health records, tax filings, US bank activity
Application_Basis: Residency in Canada for at least 1,095 days within four years prior to application
Evidence_Assessed: Education, health, tax records; lack of employment and family ties
Relief_Sought: Allowance of appeal and remand for reconsideration
Governing_Rule: Applicants must reside in Canada for 1,095 days within four years preceding application
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Minimal employment history, lack of strong familial or economic ties to Canada
Outcome: Appeal allowed; decision set aside; case remanded
Harm_Assessment: Unfair denial of citizenship due to incomplete assessment of residency
Cause_Description: Citizenship application denied based on perceived insufficient evidence of Canadian residency
Evidence_Handling: Failure to assess cumulative weight of available evidence
Evidence_Issues: Gaps in documentation, emphasis on US financial activity
Residency_Compliance: Alleged failure to meet 1,095-day physical presence requirement
Evidence_Assessment: Incomplete and decontextualized evaluation of applicant's ties to Canada
Decision_Rationale: Judge erred by not considering all evidence in context; full record supports potential residency
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of comprehensive employment records, reliance on foreign financial activity
